text:
Hi !
When Quickbooks is integrated with HubSpot. Can we use HubSpot API calls to look for invoices and associate them to deals ?

Thanks <@U26BLKGE4> Yeah, our marketers love CTA’s in order to track their campaigns, but they are _really_ limited in their implementation, especially when you start looking at component based design/implmentation

Would love to see HS combine CTAs with custom event tracking; at the end of the day I feel like most of the functionality of a CTA could be handled with a single global script and some data-attributes. Would also be great to get rid of the FOUC many CTAs suffer from
does anyone know the best way to create a custom module where you query multiple blog (say 5 different blogs - sorted by a single tag) ?

My organization would like to use the sandbox feature but it appears to still be disabled. Is there an ETA on when sandbox account will become available?
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/account/set-up-a-HubSpot-sandbox-account>
is there a way to convert blog id to blog name?

My organization uses Salesforce and HubSpot.  We use Salesforce campaigns to categorize and roll up our revenue.  I'm curious if anyone has found an equivalent way of doing this in HubSpot.  For example you can use HubSpot list in the same way you use Salesforce campaigns for contacts, but not for deals/opportunities.
Are you able to do this with filtered attribution reporting? the deal attribution reports on Marketing Hub Enterprise is fantastic :slightly_smiling_face:
These reports are great for attribution which is done automatically, and sometime you might just want to bucket revenue manually.
Perhaps we just need to re-think how we  organize things.

OMG yes. I will be honest, I don’t have a ton of experience with GA because I have always been at places where other folks don’t have experience with GA and they just rely on their automation too for reporting. Hence I haven’t used Event Tracking but I am learning (the hard way) this is pretty damn standard.

Also that FOUC! that was my first reason I hated HubSpot CTA’s but I think after seeing it for so long I don’t notice it anymore. Its like that squeaky door that you never bother putting some WD40 on and then you just stop noticing it altogether

*Can I “plug” my own app to Operations Hub integrations?*
I’m connecting HubSpot and a GDPR system that has an API. In HubSpot I would create a workflow that would check for subscription changes and push those changes to the GDPR system. But GDPR system can also receive unsubscribes directly that I need to get into HubSpot. The system offers a webhook functionality. So now I’m trying to figure out is HubSpot Operations Hub (or any other part of HubSpot) able to receive a random JSON and let me process it and besed on that unsubsrcribe a contact?
